channel.title: ODBC DSN on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in ODBC DSN on 0x000216

item.title: Setting up a Dynamics GP Data Source Name on a 64-bit Windows operating system
item.description: This article addresses the issue of a Dynamics GP DSN not appearing in the application, even when it’s visible in the Data Sources window. This commonly happens on 64-bit Windows systems. Dynamics GP, being a 32-bit application, needs a 32-bit ODBC Data Source Name (DSN) to connect to SQL Server. While DSN setup is usually straightforward, problems arise on 64-bit Windows versions. The standard method of setting up a DSN using Administrative Tools –> Data Sources utilizes the 64-bit ODBC Administrator.
